info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:16AM EDT until April 6 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville.
White Lick Creek at Mooresville.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
.Additional widespread heavy rainfall Friday night has led to Minor to Moderate Flooding on several streams and creeks across central Indiana. Flooding will crest on most creeks later today and recede through minor flood later this weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Major flood in progress. Flooding of a few homes in the New Palestine area begins. Sugar Creek is extensively flooding. Some local river roads flooded by a few feet of water. Shelby CR 700N may be flooded east of the bridge over Sugar Creek especially if Buck Creek at Acton is 13 feet or higher. Several homes possibly damaged in western Shelby County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Saturday was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 730 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING
